verses.verse: I made <WH3772> a covenant <WH1285> with my eyes; <WH5869> why <WH4100> then should I think <WH995> on a maid? <WH1330>
For what <WH4100> portion <WH2506> of God <WH433> is there from above? <WH4605> and what inheritance <WH5159> of the Almighty <WH7706> from on high? <WH4791>
Is not destruction <WH343> to the wicked? <WH5767> and a strange <WH5235> punishment to the workers <WH6466> of iniquity? <WH205>
Does not he see <WH7200> my ways, <WH1870> and count <WH5608> all <WH3605> my steps? <WH6806>
If <WH518> I have walked <WH1980> with vanity, <WH7723> or if my foot <WH7272> has hurried <WH2363> to deceit; <WH4820>
Let me be weighed <WH8254> in an even <WH6664> balance <WH3976> that God <WH433> may know <WH3045> my integrity. <WH8538>

If <WH518> my step <WH838> has turned <WH5186> out of the way, <WH1870> and my heart <WH3820> walked <WH1980> after <WH310> my eyes, <WH5869> and if any blot <WH3971> has stuck <WH1692> to my hands; <WH3709>
Then let me sow, <WH2232> and let another <WH312> eat; <WH398> yes, let my offspring <WH6631> be rooted <WH8327> out.
If <WH518> my heart <WH3820> have been deceived <WH6601> by a woman, <WH802> or if I have laid wait <WH693> at <WH5921> my neighbor's <WH7453> door; <WH6607>
Then let my wife <WH802> grind <WH2912> to another, <WH312> and let others <WH312> bow <WH3766> down <WH3766> on her.
For this <WH1931> is an heinous <WH2154> crime; <WH2154> yes, it is an iniquity <WH5771> to be punished by the judges. <WH6414>
For it is a fire <WH784> that consumes <WH398> to destruction, <WH11> and would root <WH8327> out all <WH3605> my increase. <WH8393>
If <WH518> I did despise <WH3988> the cause <WH4941> of my manservant <WH5650> or of my maidservant, <WH519> when they contended <WH7378> with me;
What <WH4100> then shall I do when <WH3588> God <WH410> rises <WH6965> up? and when <WH3588> he visits, <WH6485> what <WH4100> shall I answer <WH7725> him?
Did not he that made <WH6213> me in the womb <WH990> make <WH6213> him? and did not one <WH259> fashion <WH3559> us in the womb? <WH7358>
If <WH518> I have withheld <WH4513> the poor <WH1800> from their desire, <WH2656> or have caused the eyes <WH5869> of the widow <WH490> to fail; <WH3615>
Or have eaten <WH398> my morsel <WH6595> myself alone, <WH905> and the fatherless <WH3490> has not eaten <WH398> thereof;
(For from my youth <WH5271> he was brought <WH1431> up with me, as with a father, <WH1> and I have guided <WH5148> her from my mother's <WH517> womb; <WH990>)
If <WH518> I have seen <WH7200> any perish <WH6> for want <WH1097> of clothing, <WH3830> or any poor <WH34> without <WH369> covering; <WH3682>
If <WH518> his loins <WH2504> have not blessed <WH1288> me, and if he were not warmed <WH2552> with the fleece <WH1488> of my sheep; <WH3532>
If <WH518> I have lifted <WH5130> up my hand <WH3027> against <WH5921> the fatherless, <WH3490> when <WH3588> I saw <WH7200> my help <WH5833> in the gate: <WH8179>
Then let my arm <WH3802> fall <WH5307> from my shoulder <WH7929> blade, <WH7929> and my arm <WH248> be broken <WH7665> from the bone. <WH7070>
For destruction <WH343> from God <WH410> was a terror <WH6343> to me, and by reason of his highness <WH7613> I could <WH3201> not endure.
If <WH518> I have made <WH7760> gold <WH2091> my hope, <WH3689> or have said <WH559> to the fine gold, <WH3800> You are my confidence; <WH4009>
If <WH518> I rejoice <WH8055> because <WH3588> my wealth <WH2428> was great, <WH7227> and because <WH3588> my hand <WH3027> had gotten <WH4672> much; <WH3524>
If <WH518> I beheld <WH7200> the sun <WH216> when <WH3588> it shined, <WH1984> or the moon <WH3394> walking <WH1980> in brightness; <WH3368>
And my heart <WH3820> has been secretly <WH5643> enticed, <WH6601> or my mouth <WH6310> has kissed <WH5401> my hand: <WH3027>
This <WH1931> also <WH1571> were an iniquity <WH5771> to be punished by the judge: <WH6416> for I should have denied <WH3584> the God <WH410> that is above. <WH4605>
If <WH518> I rejoice <WH8055> at the destruction <WH6365> of him that hated <WH8130> me, or lifted <WH5782> up myself when <WH3588> evil <WH7451> found <WH4672> him:
Neither <WH3808> have I suffered <WH5414> my mouth <WH2441> to sin <WH2398> by wishing <WH7592> a curse <WH423> to his soul. <WH5315>
If <WH518> the men <WH4962> of my tabernacle <WH168> said <WH559> not, Oh that we had of his flesh! <WH1320> we cannot <WH3808> be satisfied. <WH7646>
The stranger <WH1616> did not lodge <WH3885> in the street: <WH2351> but I opened <WH6605> my doors <WH1817> to the travelers. <WH734>
If <WH518> I covered <WH3680> my transgressions <WH6588> as Adam, <WH121> by hiding <WH2934> my iniquity <WH5771> in my bosom: <WH2243>

Did I fear <WH6206> a great <WH7227> multitude, <WH1995> or did the contempt <WH937> of families <WH4940> terrify <WH2865> me, that I kept silence, <WH1826> and went <WH3318> not out of the door? <WH6607>

Oh that one would hear <WH8085> me! behold, <WH2005> my desire <WH8420> is, that the Almighty <WH7706> would answer <WH6030> me, and that my adversary <WH376> <WH7379> had written <WH3789> a book. <WH5612>
Surely <WH518> <WH3808> I would take <WH5375> it on my shoulder, <WH7926> and bind <WH6029> it as a crown <WH5850> to me.
I would declare <WH5046> to him the number <WH4557> of my steps; <WH6806> as a prince <WH5057> would I go <WH7126> near <WH7126> to him.
If <WH518> my land <WH127> cry <WH2199> against <WH5921> me, or that the furrows <WH8525> likewise <WH3162> thereof complain; <WH1058>
If <WH518> I have eaten <WH398> the fruits <WH3581> thereof without <WH1097> money, <WH3701> or have caused the owners <WH1167> thereof to lose <WH5307> their life: <WH5315>
Let thistles <WH2336> grow <WH3318> instead <WH8478> of wheat, <WH2406> and cockle <WH890> instead <WH8478> of barley. <WH8184> The words <WH1697> of Job <WH347> are ended. <WH8552>
